title: How to Make Foam Bath Stickers

steps.headline: Purchase Craft Foam.
steps.description: This is available at most craft stores, and even some "department" stores.

steps.headline: Draw or trace the shapes you want onto the foam.
steps.description: Cookie Cutters work well for foam toy templates, and you can trace any shape from a printed page that you like as well.

steps.headline: Supervise the cutting carefully for younger children, as sharp scissors will be needed for the thicker foams.
Toss the new "toys" into the tub with the kids and let them get wet.
steps.description: When wet, the foam sticks to most non-porous surfaces.

steps.headline: Enjoy bath time again... distracting the kids with the foam toy "stickers" while you get the kids clean!

text: Purchase Craft Foam. This is available at most craft stores, and even some "department" stores. Draw or trace the shapes you want onto the foam. Cookie Cutters work well for foam toy templates, and you can trace any shape from a printed page that you like as well. Supervise the cutting carefully for younger children, as sharp scissors will be needed for the thicker foams.  Toss the new "toys" into the tub with the kids and let them get wet. When wet, the foam sticks to most non-porous surfaces. Enjoy bath time again... distracting the kids with the foam toy "stickers" while you get the kids clean!  Finished.
